attributes.action: introduce a minimum sentence for mentally ill criminals who kill their victims.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
When mentally ill violent criminals kill and are found guilty of manslaughter on the grounds of diminished responsibility, they are often detained under the Mental Health Act. 
If so they receive an indefinite sentence during which they are treated in secure facilities until a judge believes that they are well enough for release. There is no minimum sentence.

Early release, or fear of it can cause a sense of injustice for victims’ friends and family, and we therefore believe that introducing a minimum term of incarceration would provide them with a feeling of justice.

It would also show that the Government acknowledges their grief and places value on the lives taken.

government_responses.details:
